doc: Hugh Jackman https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hugh_Jackman 1 Hugh Michael Jackman (born 12 October 1968) is an Australian actor, singer, and producer. Jackman has won international recognition for his roles in a variety of film genres. He is known for his long-running role as Wolverine in the X-Men film series, as well as for his lead roles in films such as the romantic-comedy fantasy Kate Leopold (2001), the action-horror film Van Helsing (2004), the magic-themed drama The Prestige (2006), the epic fantasy drama The Fountain (2006), the epic historical romantic drama Australia (2008), the film version of Les Misérables (2012), the thriller Prisoners (2013), and the musical The Greatest Showman (2017). His work in Les Misérables earned him his first Academy Award nomination for Best Actor and his first Golden Globe Award for Best Actor – Motion Picture Musical or Comedy in 2013. In Broadway theatre, Jackman won a Tony Award for his role in The Boy from Oz. A four-time host of the Tony Awards themselves, he won an Emmy Award for one of these appearances. Jackman also hosted the 81st Academy Awards on 22 February 2009. Hugh_Michael_Jackman ( born 12_October_1968 ) is an_Australian_actor , singer , and producer . Jackman has_won international_recognition for his_roles in a_variety of film_genres . He is_known for his_long-running_role as Wolverine in the_X-Men_film_series , as_well_as for his_lead_roles in films such_as the_romantic-comedy_fantasy_Kate_(_2001_) , the_action-horror_film_Van_Helsing_(_2004_) , the_magic-themed_drama The_Prestige_(_2006_) , the_epic_fantasy drama The_Fountain_(_2006_) , the_epic_historical_romantic_drama_Australia_(_2008_) , the_film_version of Les_Misérables_(_2012_) , the_thriller_Prisoners ( 2013_) , and the_musical_The_Greatest_Showman_(_2017_) . His_work in Les_Misérables earned him his_first_Academy_Award_nomination for Best_Actor and his_first_Golden_Globe_Award for_Best_Actor – Motion_Picture_Musical_or_Comedy in 2013 . In Broadway_theatre , Jackman won a_Tony_Award for his_role in The_Boy from Oz . A_four-time_host of the_Tony_Awards themselves , he won an_Emmy_Award for one of these_appearances . Jackman also hosted the_81st_Academy_Awards on 22_February_2009 . 'O', 'B', 'I', 'I', 'O', 'O', 'O', 'O', 'O', 'B', 'I', 'O', 'O', 'B', 'I', 'I', 'I', 'B', 'I', 'I', 'I'] {PERSON[Hugh_Michael_Jackman]} ( born 12 October 1968 ) is an Australian actor , singer , and producer . {PERSON[Jackman]} has won international recognition for his roles in a variety of film genres . He is known for his long-running role as Wolverine in the X-Men film series , as well as for his lead roles in films such as the romantic-comedy fantasy Kate {PERSON[Leopold]} ( 2001 ) , the action-horror film {PERSON[Van_Helsing]} ( 2004 ) , the magic-themed drama The Prestige ( 2006 ) , the epic fantasy drama The Fountain ( 2006 ) , the epic historical romantic drama {LOCATION[Australia]} ( 2008 ) , the film version of {LOCATION[Les_Misérables]} ( 2012 ) , the thriller Prisoners ( 2013 ) , and the musical The Greatest Showman ( 2017 ) . His work in {PERSON[Les_Misérables]} earned him his first Academy Award nomination for Best Actor and his first Golden Globe Award for Best Actor – Motion Picture Musical or Comedy in 2013 . In {LOCATION[Broadway]} theatre , {PERSON[Jackman]} won a Tony Award for his role in The Boy from Oz . A four-time host of the Tony Awards themselves , he won an Emmy Award for one of these appearances . {PERSON[Jackman]} also hosted the 81st Academy Awards on 22 February 2009 . {PERSON[Hugh_Michael_Jackman]} ( born 12 October 1968 ) is an {MISC[Australian]} actor , singer , and producer . {PERSON[Jackman]} has won international recognition for his roles in a variety of film genres . He is known for his long-running role as {PERSON[Wolverine]} in the X-Men film series , as well as for his lead roles in films such as the romantic-comedy fantasy {PERSON[Kate_]} ( 2001 ) , the action-horror film {PERSON[Van_Helsing]} ( 2004 ) , the magic-themed drama The Prestige ( 2006 ) , the epic fantasy drama {LOCATION[The_Fountain]} ( 2006 ) , the epic historical romantic drama {LOCATION[Australia]} ( 2008 ) , the film version of {ORGANIZATION[Les_Misérables]} ( 2012 ) , the thriller Prisoners ( 2013 ) , and the musical The {ORGANIZATION[Greatest_Showman]} ( 2017 ) . His work in {LOCATION[Les_Misérables]} earned him his first {ORGANIZATION[Academy_Award]} nomination for {ORGANIZATION[Best_Actor]} and his first {ORGANIZATION[Golden_Globe_Award_for_Best_Actor]} – {ORGANIZATION[Motion_Picture_Musical]} or Comedy in 2013 . In {LOCATION[Broadway]} theatre , {PERSON[Jackman]} won a {PERSON[Tony_Award]} for his role in The Boy from {LOCATION[Oz]} . A four-time host of the {PERSON[Tony_Awards]} themselves , he won an {MISC[Emmy_Award]} for one of these appearances . {PERSON[Jackman]} also hosted the 81st Academy Awards on 22 February 2009 . {PERSON[Hugh_Michael_Jackman]} ( born 12 {DATE[October_1968]} ) is an Australian actor , singer , and producer . {PERSON[Jackman]} has won international recognition for his roles in a variety of film genres . He is known for his long-running role as Wolverine in the X-Men film series , as well as for his lead roles in films such as the romantic-comedy fantasy {ORGANIZATION[Kate_]} ( 2001 ) , the action-horror film Van Helsing ( 2004 ) , the magic-themed drama The Prestige ( 2006 ) , the epic fantasy drama The Fountain ( 2006 ) , the epic historical romantic drama {LOCATION[Australia]} ( {DATE[2008]} ) , the film version of Les Misérables ( 2012 ) , the thriller Prisoners ( 2013 ) , and the musical The Greatest Showman ( 2017 ) . His work in {LOCATION[Les_Misérables]} earned him his first Academy Award nomination for Best Actor and his first Golden Globe Award for Best Actor – Motion Picture Musical or Comedy in {DATE[2013]} . In Broadway theatre , {PERSON[Jackman]} won a Tony Award for his role in The Boy from Oz . A four-time host of the {ORGANIZATION[Tony_Awards]} themselves , he won an Emmy Award for one of these appearances . Jackman also hosted the {ORGANIZATION[81st_Academy_Awards]} on 22 {DATE[February_2009]} .
